name: Zusha
description: '''Zusha''' is an American [[Hasidic Judaism|Hasidic]] [[folk rock]]/[[world music]] band from [[Manhattan]], [[New York (state)|New York]]. Formed in 2013, Zusha consists of lead vocalist [[Shlomo Gaisin]] and guitarist/vocalist Zachariah Goldschmiedt. Their music pairs traditional Hasidic [[Nigun|''nigunim'']] (wordless vocal melodies) with elements of [[Folk music|folk]], [[Rock music|rock]], [[Soul music|soul]], [[jazz]], [[ska]], and [[reggae]]. They have performed at venues including the [[Bowery Ballroom]] and the [[Knitting Factory]]. Their 2014 self-titled debut EP reached No. 9 on ''[[Billboard charts|Billboard]]''<nowiki>'</nowiki>s [[World Albums]] chart, while their debut album ''Kavana'' (2016) reached No. 2 on the same chart. Their song "Pashut" appeared in trailers for the 2017 film [[Menashe (film)|''Menashe'']], while another song, "Yoel's Nigun", was sampled by rapper [[JID]] for his 2022 single "[[Dance Now]]".
